body:
Problem: Current behavior of stateful intro message is too persistent.
  For example, it is still drawn if new empty buffer is shown in current
  window (either by explicitly setting it or after `tabnew`). Although
  the buffer is empty, the act of it being shown should be made visible.

Solution: Make intro message persist if all is true:
    - Current buffer is the same as it was just after start, i.e. empty
      nameless with initial handle (set to 1).
    - Current window is the same as it was just after start, i.e. single
      non-floating with initial handle (set to 1000).

comment_data.body: This will show intro if buffer 1 is shown in a floating window that has been entered, regardless of what the buffer in the non-floating window is.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2715,8 +2715,9 @@ void list_version(void)
 /// Whether it still is not too late to show an intro message
 bool may_show_intro(void)
 {
-  return (buf_is_empty(firstwin->w_buffer)
-          && (firstwin->w_buffer->b_fname == NULL)
+  return (buf_is_empty(curbuf)
+          && (curbuf->b_fname == NULL)
+          && (curbuf->handle == 1)
